Description: Rim, wall and handle sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; two added red lines on rim, three on wall; exterior: black on rim and top of wall; handle zone and lower wall reserved; handle black save for interior; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B1
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies this sherd as a Type 10.2.Ag South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 10 cups were mass produced and include numerous variants. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type V (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B1 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Numerous Type 10 South Ionian cups have been found at Naukratis, as well as in the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra and at Megara Hyblaea on Sicily, and at Berezan on the Black Sea (Posamentir 2006, 165). The place of production of the vase was determined as probably Miletus based on the results of NAA analysis carried out by Hans Mommsen, Bonn, on another sherd (British Museum 1886,0401.1025) from Naukratis and of same shape, decoration, and fabric. The number 187 is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 187)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 658, no. 148, pl. 23.1.1)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 325)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.691) (Phase 3)
